reasoning: OMIM and Orphanet describe the same developmental syndrome due to BPTF haploinsufficiency with variable expressivity; hence they represent a single entity.

entities: ['Rippling muscle disease 2', 'Myopathy, distal, Tateyama type', 'Creatine phosphokinase, elevated serum']
reasoning: OMIM describes skeletal caveolinopathies as a clinical continuum with overlapping presentations and shared loss/mislocalization of CAV3; the same variants can cause rippling, distal myopathy, or isolated hyperCKemia.
Cardiac channelopathy with gain-of-function effect on late sodium current is mechanistically and clinically distinct from skeletal caveolinopathies.
Listed by OMIM as a separate phenotype with families lacking skeletal muscle signs; clinical management and organ system differ from both skeletal spectrum and LQT9.

entities: ['Cataract 16, multiple types', 'Early-onset nuclear cataract', 'Early-onset posterior polar cataract', 'Early-onset lamellar cataract']
reasoning: OMIM consolidates multiple cataract morphologies under CTRCT16 and Orphanet lists specific early-onset cataract subtypes; these represent lens-only disease with overlapping mechanisms and presentation.
OMIM and Orphanet describe the same adult-onset CRYAB-related myofibrillar myopathy entity with AD inheritance; Orphanet label is a synonymic framing.

entities: ['Myopathy, myofibrillar, 2B, infantile-onset', 'Fatal infantile hypertonic myofibrillar myopathy']
reasoning: Both sources describe a severe infantile, hypertonic, rapidly fatal myofibrillar myopathy due to homozygous truncating CRYAB variants with LOF and AR inheritance.
OMIM and Orphanet both recognize CRYAB-associated isolated dilated cardiomyopathy as a distinct, predominantly AD entity.

entities: ['Reducing body myopathy, X-linked 1a, severe, infantile or early childhood onset', 'Reducing body myopathy, X-linked 1b, with late childhood or adult onset', 'Scapuloperoneal myopathy, X-linked dominant']
reasoning: SPM kindred was reinterpreted as having reducing bodies; RBM1A/RBM1B share pathological hallmark and LIM2 dominant-negative mechanism with overlapping X-linked dominant/semidominant inheritance.

entities: ['Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy 6, X-linked', 'Myopathy, X-linked, with postural muscle atrophy']
reasoning: OMIM maps both to the same entry (300696) with overlapping features (contractures, rigid spine, cardiac involvement) and shared isoform-impairing mechanisms without reducing bodies.
OMIM describes FCMSU as distinct despite some similarity to XMPMA and attributes a specific splice change causing FHL1C-like shift with a unique faciocardiomusculoskeletal syndrome.

proposed_label: Hereditary leiomyomatosis and renal cell cancer

GeneReviews includes sebaceous tumors and glioblastoma within Lynch syndrome; OMIM shows Muir-Torre largely due to heterozygous MSH2 variants. Same mechanism (heterozygous LoF) and AD inheritance with variable expressivity support lumping.

entities: ['Mismatch repair cancer syndrome 2', 'Constitutional mismatch repair deficiency syndrome']
reasoning: OMIM MMRCS2 and Orphanet CMMRD describe the same AR, biallelic MSH2 loss-of-function disorder with early-onset malignancies; these should be unified under a single AR entity.

entities: ['Multiple endocrine neoplasia IIA', 'Thyroid carcinoma, familial medullary', 'Pheochromocytoma']
reasoning: GeneReviews considers FMTC a variant of MEN2A; OMIM shows shared gain-of-function RET mechanisms and overlapping management, with pheochromocytoma as a MEN2A feature.
Treated as a distinct MEN2 phenotype in GeneReviews with characteristic features and predominant M918T activating variant; clinical course and management differ from MEN2A/FMTC.
Loss-of-function/reduced RET expression and complex susceptibility model contrast with MEN2 gain-of-function; distinct clinical phenotype and management.

entities: ['Developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 13', 'Seizures, benign familial infantile, 5', 'Cognitive impairment with or without cerebellar ataxia', 'Familial myoclonic epilepsy 2']
